concept.title: Disable Transport Layer Security in version 1.2

conbody.p: You can choose to disable Transport Layer Security (TLS) in version 1.2 security profiles. You might consider disabling TLS for communication that occurs behind a firewall. For example, if TLS traffic is managed by load balancers, you might choose to disable TLS for communication between the load balancers and . Disabling TLS can lead to improved performance in when TLS is already operating on communication outside the firewall. By default, TLS is enabled. For more information about how to disable and enable TLS, see .
